com.guidewire.util
Class Throw

java.lang.Object
  com.guidewire.util.Throw

public class Throw
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for conveniently throwing exceptions. Works well in combination with the companion class ArgCheck.

Author:
jburton

Constructor Detail

Throw

public Throw()
Method Detail

unless

public static void unless(java.lang.String errMsg)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
Throws a RuntimeException if the given message is non-null. The typical use is to perform some test in a ternary operator, so that the message string is only computed if the condition we wish to check is false, thus:

Throw.unless(someCondition ? null : "Error Message");

Parameters:
errMsg - the message of the RuntimeException, or null for no exception
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if errMsg != null

unless

public static void unless(boolean condition,
                          java.lang.String errMsg)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
Throws a RuntimeException if the condition is false. You should use Throw.unless(String) which is more efficient, unless errMsg is cheap to calculate (i.e. just a constant String).

Parameters:
condition - the condition to check for
errMsg - the message of the RuntimeException
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if condition == false

unless

public static void unless(java.lang.RuntimeException exception)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
Like Throw.unless(String) but lets you specify the exact exception to throw. The typical use is to perform some test in a ternary operator, so that the exception is only constructed if the condition we wish to check is false, thus:

Throw.unless(someCondition ? null : new IllegalStateException("Error Message"));

Parameters:
exception - the exeption to throw, or null for no exception.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException

illegalStateUnless

public static void illegalStateUnless(java.lang.String errMsg)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Throws an IllegalStateException if the given message is non-null. The typical use is to perform some test in a ternary operator, so that the message string is only computed if the condition we wish to check is false, thus:

Throw.illegalStateUnless(someCondition ? null : "Error Message");

Parameters:
errMsg - the message of the IllegalStateException, or null for no exception
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if errMsg != null

illegalArgumentUnless

public static void illegalArgumentUnless(java.lang.String errMsg)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the given message is non-null. The typical use is to perform some test in a ternary operator, so that the message string is only computed if the condition we wish to check is false, thus:

Throw.illegalArgumentUnless(someCondition ? null : "Error Message");

Note that it's usually easier to throw IllegalArgumentExceptions with ArgCheck.

Parameters:
errMsg - the message of the IllegalArgumentException, or null for no exception
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if errMsg != null

illegalConfigUnless

public static void illegalConfigUnless(java.lang.String errMsg)
                                throws GWConfigurationException
Throws a GWConfigurationException if the given message is non-null. The typical use is to perform some test in a ternary operator, so that the message string is only computed if the condition we wish to check is false, thus:

Throw.unless(someCondition ? null : "Error Message");

Parameters:
errMsg - the message of the GWConfigurationException, or null for no exception
Throws:
GWConfigurationException - if errMsg != null
